channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A breast cancer researcher at Harvard loses 1/3 of her staff amid NIH funding cuts
item.description: Amid NIH funding delays, clawbacks and uncertainty, a scientist at Harvard who studies breast cancer has lost one third of her lab employees and wonders if she can continue her research experiments.
item.content:encoded: Amid NIH funding delays, clawbacks and uncertainty, a scientist at Harvard who studies breast cancer has lost one third of her lab employees and wonders if she can continue her research experiments.
item.dc:creator: Martha Bebinger

item.title: A new animated film offers a way for kids to learn about contemporary Native culture
item.description: This Thanksgiving, a new animated film offers teachers a resource to talk about contemporary Native Americans with their students.
item.content:encoded: This Thanksgiving, a new animated film offers teachers a resource to talk about contemporary Native Americans with their students.
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills

item.title: Chloe Zhao's 'Hamnet' tells a story of grief and the healing power of art
item.description: Based on Maggie O'Farrell's acclaimed 2020 novel about William Shakespeare and his wife, Agnes, Chloe Zhao's beautiful film Hamnet tells a story of tragedy and the healing power of art.
item.content:encoded: Based on Maggie O'Farrell's acclaimed 2020 novel about William Shakespeare and his wife, Agnes, Chloe Zhao's beautiful film Hamnet tells a story of tragedy and the healing power of art.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Nebraska's newest public official is 10-years-old
item.description: The Kid Governor program is a nationwide initiative that helps teach kids about government by holding elections. Nebraska just elected 10-year-old Charlie Couch as it's first kid governor.
item.content:encoded: The Kid Governor program is a nationwide initiative that helps teach kids about government by holding elections. Nebraska just elected 10-year-old Charlie Couch as it's first kid governor.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: 83 years ago, the Cocoanut Grove Nightclub fire changed safety codes and burn care
item.description: After more than 80 years, the Cocoanut Grove nightclub fire remains one of the nation's deadliest. Many safety lessons came from the tragedy that claimed more than 500 lives in Boston.
item.content:encoded: After more than 80 years, the Cocoanut Grove nightclub fire remains one of the nation's deadliest. Many safety lessons came from the tragedy that claimed more than 500 lives in Boston.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Beland

item.title: States sue the Trump administration over major homelessness spending cuts
item.description: States are suing the Trump administration over its plan to massively cut back long-term housing for homeless people. Advocates say the changes could push more than 100,000 residents onto the streets.
item.content:encoded: States are suing the Trump administration over its plan to massively cut back long-term housing for homeless people. Advocates say the changes could push more than 100,000 residents onto the streets.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Denmark's 'flexicurity' policies help get people back on their feet
item.description: If you lose your job in Denmark, it's not time to scream at the skies quite yet. The government has a unique set of policies called "flexicurity" designed to help get you back on your feet.
item.content:encoded: If you lose your job in Denmark, it's not time to scream at the skies quite yet. The government has a unique set of policies called "flexicurity" designed to help get you back on your feet.
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: Holiday cyber scams are getting more inventive
item.description: Hackers are hoping to take advantage of the holiday season, and they're not just stealing money or data.
item.content:encoded: Hackers are hoping to take advantage of the holiday season, and they're not just stealing money or data.
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: Virginia could be a key state in countering Trump's redistricting push
item.description: If Virginia Democrats go ahead with redistricting, it would go a long way to countering the GOP and President Trump. But it would challenge the governor-elect's bipartisan image and anger Republicans.
item.content:encoded: If Virginia Democrats go ahead with redistricting, it would go a long way to countering the GOP and President Trump. But it would challenge the governor-elect's bipartisan image and anger Republicans.
item.dc:creator: Jahd Khalil

item.title: Pope Leo's Lebanon visit sparks frustration as he'll skip the most battered region
item.description: Pope Leo visits war-torn Lebanon but some in the country with the biggest percentage of Christians in the region are upset he's skipping the most battered part.
item.content:encoded: Pope Leo visits war-torn Lebanon but some in the country with the biggest percentage of Christians in the region are upset he's skipping the most battered part.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf
